content.html:
Modern Health, frameworks, performance, and harm ‚Äì Eric Bailey

A person seeking help in a time of crisis does not care about TypeScript, tree shaking, hot module replacement, A/B tests, burndown charts, NPS, OKRs, KPIs, or other startup jargon. Developer experience does not count for shit if the person using the thing they built can‚Äôt actually get what they need.
content.value:
Modern Health, frameworks, performance, and harm ‚Äì Eric Bailey

content.html:
We‚Äôre all trying to find the guy who did this

Imagine the web is a storefront, React is a hot dog car, and here‚Äôs Create React App dressed as a hot dog:

HTML is the cornerstone of the web ‚Äî so why does creating a ‚ÄúReact app‚Äù produce an empty HTML file? Why are we not taking advantage of the most basic feature of the web‚Äîthe ability to see content quickly before all the interactive code loads? Why do we wait to start loading the data until after all the client-side code has finished loading?
content.value:

content.html:
The Web Platform Is Back

So much ink spilled supposedly explaining what ‚Äúthe web platform‚Äù is ‚Ä¶when the truth is you can just swap in the ‚Äúthe web‚Äù every time that phrase is used here or anywhere else.

Anyway, the gist of this piece is: the web is good, actually.
content.value:
